metadata.title: CVE-2017-0647 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
An information disclosure vulnerability in libziparchive could enable a local malicious application to access data outside of its permission levels. This issue is rated as Moderate because it could be used to access sensitive data without permission. Product: Android. Versions: 5.0.2, 5.1.1, 6.0, 6.0.1, 7.0, 7.1.1, 7.1.2. Android ID: A-36392138.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-0647` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

adb - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libadb - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libbacktrace - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libbase - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libcrypto-utils - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libcutils - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-liblog - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libnativebridge - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libnativeloader - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libsparse - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libutils - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-libziparchive - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-platform-system-core-headers - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-sdk-libsparse-utils - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
android-tools-mkbootimg - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
append2simg - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
fastboot - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
img2simg - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
mkbootimg - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
simg2img - 1:7.0.0+r33-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: android-platform-system-core package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.0.0+r33-2').
